thread.title: Singapore ruling party popularity tested in general polls
thread.title_full: Singapore ruling party popularity tested in general polls | News24

author: news24.com
title: Singapore ruling party popularity tested in general polls
text:
Singapore - Singaporeans voted on Friday in general elections that are expected to retain the ruling People's Action Party 50-year-old hold on power by another five years.
But the percentage of votes the party garners will be closely watched as a barometer of its popularity during tough economic times.
Riding on a wave of public dissatisfaction the opposition hopes to increase its strength in Parliament from the meagre seven seats it currently holds, all by the Workers' Party. During the campaign they emphasised the growing income disparity, restrictions on free speech, overcrowding caused by immigration and rising cost of living - Singapore is the world's most expensive city according to an international survey.
"Every election is different. We always watch carefully. We have done our best," Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said after casting his vote. "This is a major turning point for Singapore."
